item_description: Reliable since ’74 — if you hear the clack, you’re still alive.
TT-33 pistols deal double damage… and jam twice as fast.
Boom—surprise glitter.
Sniffs out rubles and fear with equal talent.
Time stands still in Tarkov, but Prapor still wants his watch back.
No gun? No problem—speed is armor.
“Let there be light—and a power bill to match.”
A ringing reminder that loot goblins never sleep.
Your first gun, his first favor—keep the receipts.
Twelve-gauge diplomacy — politely convincing campers.
Logs, loot, and long-range legends are made here.
Three wiggles, temporary peace.
Finders keepers, your dogtags cheaper.
Painkillers now heal teammates, but loud coughs reveal positions.
A crude hatch to safety—if you brought the power.
Speaks with bullets, not words; forged in the Motherland’s fire.
Cut the lines, cut the odds.
Gifts that jingle under fire.
A window, a heartbeat, a chance.
Last door to freedom, first door to chaos.
Therapist’s favorite gizmo—because ‘air quality’ is lethal here.
“A gangster’s spark—the boss won’t raid without it.”
Nature rewards patience—and a bolt-action bite.
Do more with less, or else.
Smells like pine sap and desperation—your ticket into the woods.
Where junk turns to loot. And toilet paper reigns supreme.
Kick like a mule, thunder like a storm — one-handed bravery.
Buckshot diplomacy in tight halls.
Resolutions and roubles.
“Minted in 1912, yet it looks freshly struck—time loops or forgery?”
Moves like a shadow through trees, vengeance breathing down your neck.

item_name: Prapor – No Rest for the Wicked [Uncommon]
item_description: Another delivery, another bullet hole.
A respectful salute to fallen frames.
“Scratched with a single word: ‘Homecoming’.”
Belt? Drum? It just keeps singing until the song is over.
Gifts in gunfire, jingles in cover.
“Ho-ho-ho! Extract with this card in stash to roll a random present case.”
You don’t see him—you see the glint, then grayscale.
Rogues don sunglasses; flashbang effects reduced by 50%.
Clean water is life; expect to pay in blood.
Paperwork and danger, hand in hand.
Echoes of gunfire bounce off broken storefronts.
Eyes first, shots later.
Corporate-backed and kitted to the teeth—precision over brute force.
Kick like a mule, speak like thunder.
'Friendly, friendly!'—shots fired.
Duct tape, dreams, and disassembled guns.
“Breathe deep, but not too deep. It’s Tarkov air, after all.”
Enemies only hear the thud as they drop.
May RNGesus smile upon you… someday.
If he blinks, you’re already on the ground.
A floor plan that shouldn’t exist, mapping corridors you’ve never seen.
Distills the good stuff. Moonshine magic for barter, booze, or bold plays.
“Heavy, leaky, and indispensable—like most Tarkov friendships.”
Handle with dread.
Steps unheard, prayers in poison — strike before the dawn.
Whispers in the night, blade in the dark.
Height is a weapon.
Coordinates flicker when exposed to UV light—follow at your own risk.
“The hum of progress—or the roar of your dwindling roubles.”
Six guards, zero mercy, one 7.62 song of pain.
Pumpkin-masked cultists flood Factory; every slug round echoes like a scream.
Candles, chants, and chase.
LED glare and panic looting.
Turns firefights into executions; mercy is not in his doctrine.
Watchtowers and warnings.
Tolerance stack tolerates no errors.
The juice to keep secret experiments humming at 230 V.
A laser hose built for hallway domination.
The ink bleeds new patterns every full moon.
USEC reach is global; bullets are the passport.
Snakes of bullets, endless buzz.
Every time you need it, it’s already gone.
A handshake at the Water Treatment.
Paid enough to defect, paid more to guard someone else’s turf.
“He heals himself faster than you can reload.”
“If it blinks blue, someone’s secrets just went missing.”
Trust is volatile; betrayal is highly flammable.
Bling now, debts later.
Turns static into whispers that know your name.
Play to spawn a Streamer-Signed Crate; contents scale with viewer hype.
Officially nobody. Unofficially everyone’s headache.
Concrete maze patrolled by restless Rogues.
Rumor has it the LEDX still glows under the dust.
One-man artillery battery—every corner is pre-fragged.
Only one leaves alive—and tweets about it.
Cold to the touch and humming with an ancient frequency.
“Knowledge is power. Discounts don’t hurt either.”
Armored bulk with a minigun; Tarkov’s traffic cop from hell.
Summons the brothers together—loot’s insane, survival rate… less so.
Own the high ground; dictate the outcome.
Worth more than your stash rent; clinics kill for one.
Where recoil goes to die; loved by USEC min-maxers everywhere.
Blueprints whispered into meta-tier monsters.
All gear is temporary—XP earned this raid is permanently doubled.
Marble floors now cracked—ambush potential intact.
Look good, frag better—100 scav heads to prove it.
Adrenaline junkie with clearance codes — breach, loot, exfil, repeat.
Secrets stacked behind steel.
“Flash the Bitcoin, buy the whole resort—bullets included.”
Six shots of pure fear.
“190 million for a couch? Worth it.”
“Gamble your junk, pray for treasure. Scavs deliver… sometimes.”
Silent lanes, fatal lessons.
“Spins the sledge like a ballerina—just a bloodier one.”
Old-school blocks worth new-school roubles.
Integrally suppressed whispers in the dark.
“Printing money—just add GPUs and time. Lots of time.”
Tracks you by footsteps; run and he will sprint.
“Calls the shots; Rogues answer with autocannon bursts.”
Blink and you’re deleted from the footage—and the raid.
A lighthouse of secrets; forgiveness costs dearly.
Pay the toll—or all extracts seal for five minutes of chaos.
Pages wax-sealed in blood; debts counted in lives, not roubles.
Black rig, 5.45 thunder—cleanse the Shoreline.
If chat gives you lemons, raid Labs.
When 7.62×54R speaks, everyone listens.
“When size matters—lug it 2 km, question your life choices.”
Authorized to use deadly force — and to bury the evidence.
Scoped glare from the lighthouse; his judgment strikes from afar.
Keycards waived for one raid; Raiders spawn with experimental tech.
“Whispers in the vents. Blood in the drains. Something watches from the dark.”
“Midnight toxin strike; the last thing you feel is numb.”
Gather every legend; unlock the one true treasure.
Paper beats bullets—sometimes.
Select-fire plastic fantastic; 1,200 RPM of panic.
An empty shell—collect them all to reveal what truly fits inside.
Whispers on the wind guide only the worthy across.
When BEAR and USEC shake hands, the whole city holds its breath.
Rumor says it opens a door that even Lightkeeper fears.
Where Tagilla falls, his echo swings eternally in the dark.
The ultimate flex item… if it even exists.
Smells like trouble.
Clue today, danger tomorrow.
Sealed vials, whispered experiments.
When the grid dies, the sun keeps the hideout alive.
Where painkillers are currency and bandages buy time.
Cold kills quicker than bullets. Keep the fire burning.
Hydration automation.
Practice makes fewer mistakes.
A truce as old as VoIP.
Candles lit, lock picked, RNG invoked.
Camo on, footsteps off—become the shrub.
The legend who lives on head-height.
Shotguns, salt, and short queues.
Opens doors that close futures.
Edges of a bigger plan.
Stares back when you stare in.
Signals of the unsayable.
Everything and nothing, inside.
Hovering two meters above ground, unbothered.
One pin, endless chaos.
You were dead before you even climbed.
Instant deletion by a pixel angle you swear didn’t exist.
You see them; they see your loot.
Two steps forward, three steps back.
You’re full, but no one can see it.
Silence before the storm… for you only.
Alive by a thread. Or a bug.
No bang, all white screen.
Green smoke, red screen.
Loot above your paygrade… literally.
It was there… then Tarkov decided otherwise.
Now you see him, now you’re down.
Aim glued to scope at the worst time.
A gauntlet of Mosins, pain, and perseverance.
Chat goes feral; Factory goes quiet.
When your ears lie but your aim doesn’t.
An SKS, a dream, and a headset.
Angles, patience, and a lucky mag.
NVGs down; pressure up; loot secured.
Math meets meta; chat learns.
Roadmaps decoded between raids.
Timing, nades, and a quick push.
Bait, switch, extract. GG.
VoIP saves a life—and a backpack.
Rule #1 written in blood.
One toss, two PMCs; chat explodes.
From pistol to powerhouse in one raid.
Sorting ASMR at light speed.
Don’t ask how it works.
Accuracy down, courage up.
Claims he knows Killa personally.
Treasure to some; fortune to none.
Factory key or bus ticket—roll the dice.
Iron sights and iron nerves.
Blue stripes, big vibes.
A nod, a wiggle, and trust issues.
He funded the exit before you spawned.
Knows prices better than therapists.
Two cans always in spawn—somehow.
Click… and then a miracle.
Guards loot like a hoard of gold.
Finds you without a map.
Betrayed by the hello you trusted.
Ultimate weapon personalization – the final tinkering.
Your gear evolves with your prestige.
Every kill, every headshot: counted.
Can’t hear the shots? You still see them.
They come in waves, never the same twice.
The only being in Tarkov that truly loves you.
The AI thinks — and you fear them.
Scavs looting like never before.
Bots grinding while you’re just breathing.
Interactive maps: exit the wiki.
Tune Tarkov exactly to your taste.
Ballistics and recoil with bite.
Sharper, darker, moodier Tarkov.
Collect them all — the wipe’s truest endgame.
Carry more, carry smarter.
No gear, no fear, just sprinting for keys.
Luck beyond measure, salt beyond reason.
Grinding while others sleep.
Buckshot is the true tutorial.
Forums explode, flea adapts.
Queue filled, gear empty.
Sidearms in hand, dreams in sight.
Roubles mean everything, for a week.
Screenshot or it didn’t happen.
Slicks before sanity.
Axes clash in dorm hallways.
Cards pulled, loot stacked.
Buys low, sells salt.
Every quest, every night.
Leaving Tarkov with nothing, and everything.
Still desyncs, but now in 4K.
Now includes free opera.
Server hamsters now fed twice daily.
Bots bunny-hop in formation.
Shotgun kicks harder than your dad.
You still hear them through three floors.
Your kick breaks your own leg.
Now blinds you, not your enemy.
Add a third toilet, efficiency up.
Salewas sell out before you click.
One chocolate bar = back pain.
1 nail, 1 bitcoin — fair trade.
Two more scavs. Good luck.
Now with 200% more trees to get lost in.
Only catches you when looting GPUs.
You never saw him, but he saw you.
Legs broken, life broken.
No ping, just boom.
Connection lost. Gear lost.
One tap across the map.
Exit denied.
Rustle, stab, end screen.
Wrong side of the breach.
Physics not included.
No armor, no chance.
Oops, my bad.
You didn’t even load in.
Click, kaboom, darkness.
One shot, twenty replies.
Thirst kills faster than bullets.
Silence, shadows, survival.
Full kit, full send.
All or nothing… with nothing.
One more raid… for Jaeger.
Exit denied.
PACA and a dream.
PS, BT, BP… spreadsheets win wars.
VoIP > bullets.
Patience pays in lead.
Scav karma? Never heard of it.
Loud, proud, and very dead.
Zero risk, maximum loot.
Spray now, aim never.
One tap, zero skill.
Raids? No thanks, I craft.
That GPU? Gone with one click.
Three seconds too slow.
The bravest disconnect.
Customs 114? Nope, Factory exit.
Click. Panic. Death.
7.62 dreams, 5.45 reality.
Full loot, zero brain.
Game unpaused. You weren’t.
Medkit first, bullets second.
Iron sights forever.
Arc too short, life shorter.
And now, you’re lost.
Your shot, their map.
Now you’re the blind one.
Game gone, loot gone.
No cheaters, no stress.
SPT plays. EFT waits.
More functional than Nikita’s vision.
No VoIP, no betrayals.
Because 8 weren’t enough.
One click, instant raid.
Buy what you want, when you want.
The true power of SPT.
By modders, not Nikita.
For creating SPT, for the mods, and for letting us play the way we want.
Unlike EFT.
Turn Tarkov into Diablo.
Balanced, stable, fun.
Level 40 in an afternoon.
SPT devs > BSG devs.
